what: How to use the Rust bindings from R?
title: Always start with an issue
code: # Read the spectra spectra_path <- metabodecon::metabodecon_file("bruker/urine") metabodecon_spectra <- metabodecon::read_spectra(spectra_path, "bruker", 10, 10) mdrb_spectra <- lapply(metabodecon_spectra, function(s) Spectrum$new(s$cs, s$si, c(-2.2, 11.8)))  # Configure the Deconvoluter deconvoluter <- Deconvoluter$new() deconvoluter$set_moving_average_smoother(4, 3) deconvoluter$add_ignore_region(4.7, 4.9)  # Deconvolute the spectra deconvolutions <- deconvoluter$deconvolute_spectra(mdrb_spectra) deconvolutions <- deconvoluter$par_deconvolute_spectra(mdrb_spectra)  # Serialization mdrb_spectra[[1]]$write_json("spectrum.json") mdrb_spectra[[1]]$write_bin("spectrum.bin") deconvolutions[[1]]$write_json("deconvolution.json") deconvolutions[[1]]$write_bin("deconvolution.bin")  # Deserialization json_spectrum <- Spectrum$read_json("spectrum.json") bin_spectrum <- Spectrum$read_bin("spectrum.bin") json_deconvolution <- Deconvolution$read_json("deconvolution.json") bin_deconvolution <- Deconvolution$read_bin("deconvolution.bin")  # Getting the Lorentzian parameters lorentzians <- lapply(deconvolutions, function(d) d$lorentzians())  # Compute the superposition of the Lorentzians for the first spectrum superposition_internal <- deconvolutions[[1]]$par_superposition_vec(spectra[[1]]$chemical_shifts())  # Alternative method A <- lorentzians[[1]]$A lambda <- lorentzians[[1]]$lambda x0 <- lorentzians[[1]]$x0 superposition_parameters <- Lorentzian$par_superposition_vec(spectra[[1]]$chemical_shifts(), A, lambda, x0)

what: How does R compile Rust during package installation?
title: Always start with an issue
text: Assume following src/Makevars file: following happens run install.packages("mdrb", repos = NULL, type = "source"): R detects package contains Rust code. R defines following environment variables, can used customize build process following steps: R_HOME: Root directory R installation SHLIB: Default name shared library built (mdrb.Linux mdrb.dll Windows) R_ARCH: Architecture, e.g. x86_64 i386 R calls make -f $R_HOME/**/Makeconv -f Makevars build package Makeconf : means dynamic link library built linking libraries defined PKG_LIBS. setting PKG_LIBS -Lrust/target/release -l_mdrb, tell linker link library named lib_mdrb directory rust/target/release. SHLIB set mdrb.dll step two, %.dll rule trigger SHLIB rule, cause creation rust/target/release/lib_mdrb.. , make continue execute commands defined %.dll invoke linker create mdrb.dll lib_mdrb.
code: PKG_LIBS = -Lrust/target/release -l_mdrb  $(SHLIB): rust/target/release/lib_mdrb.a  rust/target/release/lib_mdrb.a:     export PATH="$(PATH):$(HOME)/.cargo/bin" && \     cargo build \         --lib \         --release \         --manifest-path=rust/Cargo.toml \         --target-dir rust/target ALL_LIBS = $(PKG_LIBS) $(LOCAL_LIBS) $(SHLIB_LIBADD) $(LIBR) $(LIBINTL) %.dll:     @echo EXPORTS > $*.def     @$(NM) $^ | $(SED) -n $(SYMPAT) >> $*.def     $(SHLIB_LD) $(SHLIB_LDFLAGS) $(DLLFLAGS) -o $@ $*.def $^ $(ALL_LIBS)     @$(RM) $*.def

title: Metabodecon Rust Backend
text: Provides high-performance Rust backend metabodecon package, enabling efficient deconvolution, alignment, post-processing 1D NMR spectra. package wraps optimized Rust functions improve performance scalability large datasets. recommended way use mdrb installing metabodecon setting backend argument “rust” calling functions. Rust part package based metabodecon-rust crate. ⚠️ Attention: package experimental API subject change. using scripts /packages make sure check exact version first.

title: Metabodecon Rust Backend
text: Install R version 4.2 higher CRAN. ’re Windows install RTools CRAN. Install Rust toolchain rustup.rs. Install mdrb package running following commands R:

title: Metabodecon Rust Backend
text: mdrb primarily intended used frontend functions provided metabodecon package. However, prefer use package directly, can follow example :
code: spectrum_path <- metabodecon::metabodecon_file("bruker/urine/urine_1") r_spectrum <- metabodecon::read_spectrum(spectrum_path)  rust_spectrum <- Spectrum$new(     chemical_shifts = r_spectrum$cs,     intensities = r_spectrum$si,     signal_boundaries = quantile(r_spectrum$cs, c(0.1, 0.9)) )  deconvoluter <- Deconvoluter$new() deconvoluter$set_moving_average_smoother(iterations = 4, window_size = 3) deconvoluter$set_noise_score_selector(6.4) deconvoluter$set_analytical_fitter(iterations = 5)  deconvolution <- deconvoluter$deconvolute_spectrum(rust_spectrum)  lorentzians <- deconvolution$lorentzians() superposition_vec <- deconvolution$superposition_vec() mse <- deconvolution$mse()

title: Metabodecon Rust Backend
text: Since mdrb mostly intended dependency metabodecon direct usage, documentation mdrb scarce. However, users interested deconvolution alignment NMR spectra encouraged check metabodecon package, provides high-level interface Rust backend. metabodecon’s documentation available spang-lab.github.io/metabodecon includes pages Getting Started Contribution Guidelines Function Reference
